DataElement.preferredName: Abdominal Girth Assessment Centimeter 0 Decimal Place Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the abdominal circumference.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The measurement of the distance around the abdomen, usually at the level of the umbilicus._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The measurement of the distance around the abdomen, usually at the level of the umbilicus.

Concepts.definition: The measurement of the distance around the abdomen, usually at the level of the umbilicus.

Property.preferredDefinition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
